feature.name: daily_wage_calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily_wage_calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formula
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings intentionally overrides the formula configured in the leave policy for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it is not active. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied for daily wage calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms between leave policy and payroll modules.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll deduction amount discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Leap Year Miscalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator incorrectly handles leap years by defaulting to 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate total service period and gratuity amount calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: System does not dynamically adjust for leap years in service period calculations
known_issues.gap_statement: The gratuity calculation logic lacks leap year recognition, potentially underpaying employee benefits

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: Daily wage calculation for pro-rated amounts produces consistently lower amounts by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals. The formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but results in slight undercalculation across all employees' End of Service settlements.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation causing systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product needs enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms to ensure exact financial calculations for pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation (AED 231,821) slightly differs from manual calculation (AED 252,485), with detailed breakdown showing system uses a tiered calculation method (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year after, prorated for partial years)
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation involves complex service duration and daily wage formula with tiered rates
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential complexity in handling precise gratuity calculations for varied service durations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Leap Year Handling
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (specifically February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in service duration calculation. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation suggested 913 days by including the leap day.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently managed
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Worked in Gratuity Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates days worked with a potential extra day (622 vs 623 days), which impacts gratuity calculation precision. The platform adds one extra day in length of service duration calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Days worked calculation includes an additional day that may not align with manual calculations
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential inaccuracy in days worked computation method

known_issues.title: Discrepancy in Leave Salary Calculation Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary using a fixed divisor in policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days. User expected daily wage to be divided by 31 days, but system was dividing by 30 days, resulting in a slight salary calculation difference (2940 SAR vs expected 2988 SAR).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations that may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including daily rate divisor configurations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Varies by Monthly Working Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator configured with 'working days' setting causes leave salary accrual amounts to fluctuate month-to-month due to varying working day counts. This leads to inconsistent cumulative totals across different months.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation method based on working days causes monthly variations in leave salary accrual
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a consistent method for calculating leave salary accruals that remains stable across months with different working day counts

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses separate configurations for leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations, causing different results. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor while salary proration uses 30.42 days, leading to calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations are configured independently and may use different divisors.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method exists across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Salary Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends on work week configuration, which may not match user's initial expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator fails to correctly prorate salary when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. The system correctly prorates when departure date is in the past, but not when it's in the future.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates during payroll processing.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap exists in handling dynamic proration scenarios for employees with departure dates differing from payroll processing date.

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductionsâ€”one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes out of sync between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules when public holidays are configured after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for module communication enhancement to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Daily Wage Calculation Using Non-Standard Divisor
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculated by dividing monthly salary by 30.42 (not calendar days), potentially causing deduction amounts to exceed expected monthly salary
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect number of days in remarks for unpaid leave deduction in February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days (leap year), despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Global daily rate configuration overrides policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions. The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a global daily rate that takes precedence over individual policy settings, which can result in deductions based on gross salary instead of basic salary.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Incorrectly Displayed
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not reflect the month when leave occurred.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display logic does not preserve the initially calculated rate from the leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need a consistent daily rate display mechanism that stores and shows the rate from the original leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days per Month Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is currently based on a 26 working days per month standard: 365 (Days yearly) - 52 (Weekly off) = 313 / 12 = 26.08 working days
limitations.impact: Manual tracking required for variations in employee attendance

limitations.title: No Automatic Formula Synchronization
limitations.limitation_statement: There is no synchronized mechanism for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. Manual alignment is required.
limitations.impact: Users must manually ensure consistent daily wage calculation formulas across different system modules.

limitations.title: Salary Config Change Impact on Leave Deductions
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deductions are calculated based on salary configuration existing at the time of leave request creation. Changes to salary configuration after leave request may not automatically update pending deductions.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration changes after leave request submission

limitations.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize 366 days in leap years like 2024
limitations.impact: Potential undercalculation of service periods and associated benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision in Daily Wage Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently produce amounts less than expected by small decimal points (0.1 or 0.2).
limitations.impact: Affects accuracy of final settlements for employees leaving mid-month

limitations.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Constraint
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, not prorated for mid-month departures
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month do not receive partial month's leave balance automatically

limitations.title: Service Duration Day Counting Rules
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are handled
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity amount calculation

limitations.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of daily wage calculation for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Rigid Leave Salary Calculation Logic
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation follows a fixed policy setting that cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios or month lengths.
limitations.impact: Users cannot modify the standard calculation method to account for different month lengths or specific employee situations.

limitations.title: Leave Encashment Calculation Based on Monthly Working Days
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave encashment daily wage is calculated using the number of working days in each month, which causes monthly variations
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary accruals will differ month-to-month due to varying working day counts

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors.
limitations.impact: Potential calculation discrepancies and inconsistent salary prorations

limitations.title: Working Days Calculation Based on Work Week
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage proration is calculated based on the employee's assigned work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Proration calculation may differ from calendar day expectations depending on work week setup

limitations.title: Limited Proration Date Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly for departure dates in the past, not for future departure dates.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Inconsistent Deduction Management
limitations.limitation_statement: The system cannot reliably manage payroll deductions when leave transactions are modified, deleted, or have status changes.
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention

limitations.title: Cannot Recalculate Salary Deductions Retroactively
limitations.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically recalculate salary deductions when public holidays are added after initial payroll calculation.
limitations.impact: Manual adjustments required when configuration changes occur mid-payroll cycle

limitations.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for calculating daily wage, which differs from calendar days
limitations.impact: Deductions may not precisely match expected monthly salary amounts

limitations.title: Leap Year Day Calculation for Unpaid Leave
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations must use the actual number of calendar days in a month, particularly for February in leap years (29 days, not 31 days).
limitations.impact: Ensures accurate unpaid leave deduction calculations based on precise calendar days

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unable to automatically adjust salary based on working days
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Current system lacks built-in automation for attendance-based salary calculation
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking, managed separately for each employee

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Payroll settings daily wage calculator overrides leave policy formula. Greyed-out formula in leave policy indicates active override from payroll configuration.
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily wage calculator configuration in payroll settings to confirm the actual formula being applied for unpaid leave calculations.

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect unpaid leave deduction amount due to outdated salary configuration
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Leave request created before new salary configuration, causing calculation based on old salary setup
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the existing leave request and recreate it if the deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Gratuity amount differs from MOHRE-confirmed calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024 leap year
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust calculation to use 366 days for leap years

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: End of Service calculations show slightly lower amounts than expected
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Decimal precision error in daily wage calculation formula (basic + allowances / 30)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Ticket was escalated to development team and resolved

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Leave balance not automatically included for mid-month departure
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Monthly accrual policy requires full month completion to grant leave days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust leave balance in EOS section or switch to conditional daily accrual policy

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between expected and calculated leave salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses predefined policy configuration for daily rate divisor, which may not match user's manual calculation expectations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily rate configuration in leave policy and understand the system's calculation logic before challenging the result

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected differences in leave salary accrual totals across months
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculator set to 'working days' method, causing monthly calculation variations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Consider using 'custom days' setting for more consistent leave encashment calculations

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Mismatched leave salary and salary proration calculations
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Different divisors used for daily wage calculations (30 days vs 30.42 days)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually align leave salary and salary proration daily wage configurations to use consistent divisors

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Verify work week configuration to understand how working days are calculated
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Check employee's assigned work week policy and confirm if all days are configured as working days

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Full monthly salary displayed for offboarded employees with future departure dates
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation logic does not handle departure dates in future relative to payroll processing date
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate and adjust prorated salary based on actual days worked

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Duplicate or persistent payroll deductions after leave request modifications
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Lack of automated synchronization between leave management and payroll deduction systems
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manual intervention required to remove orphaned or duplicate deductions

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inconsistent daily wage calculation for unpaid leave
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculated as (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manual deduction adjustment or waiting for future module enhancement

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Deduction amount differs from expected monthly salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculated as monthly salary (4300) divided by 30.42, resulting in 141.35 per day, then multiplied by days in leave period
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify unpaid leave policy settings and understand the 30.42 days divisor used in calculations

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between displayed daily rate and actual calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Remarks field shows incorrect number of days, but actual calculation uses correct calendar days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify actual deduction amount by calculating daily rate using correct number of calendar days for the specific month

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected salary deductions for unpaid leave
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses a global daily rate configuration that may not align with specific policy settings
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify and potentially adjust global daily rate configuration to match intended calculation method

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Daily rate changes based on payroll processing month instead of leave occurrence month
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System recalculates daily rate dynamically during payroll processing instead of storing the original rate
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: A fix was deployed to store the initially calculated daily rate and display that amount consistently

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Leap Year Handling
claims_to_validate.statement: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (specifically February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in service duration calculation. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation suggested 913 days by including the leap day.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Worked in Gratuity Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates days worked with a potential extra day (622 vs 623 days), which impacts gratuity calculation precision. The platform adds one extra day in length of service duration calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Discrepancy in Leave Salary Calculation Days
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates leave salary using a fixed divisor in policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days. User expected daily wage to be divided by 31 days, but system was dividing by 30 days, resulting in a slight salary calculation difference (2940 SAR vs expected 2988 SAR).

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Varies by Monthly Working Days
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator configured with 'working days' setting causes leave salary accrual amounts to fluctuate month-to-month due to varying working day counts. This leads to inconsistent cumulative totals across different months.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Mismatch
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses separate configurations for leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations, causing different results. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor while salary proration uses 30.42 days, leading to calculation discrepancies.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator fails to correctly prorate salary when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. The system correctly prorates when departure date is in the past, but not when it's in the future.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductionsâ€”one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes out of sync between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Using Non-Standard Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect number of days in remarks for unpaid leave deduction in February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days (leap year), despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Global daily rate configuration overrides policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions. The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a global daily rate that takes precedence over individual policy settings, which can result in deductions based on gross salary instead of basic salary.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Incorrectly Displayed
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not reflect the month when leave occurred.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days per Month Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is currently based on a 26 working days per month standard: 365 (Days yearly) - 52 (Weekly off) = 313 / 12 = 26.08 working days

claims_to_validate.title: No Automatic Formula Synchronization
claims_to_validate.statement: There is no synchronized mechanism for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. Manual alignment is required.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Config Change Impact on Leave Deductions
claims_to_validate.statement: Unpaid leave deductions are calculated based on salary configuration existing at the time of leave request creation. Changes to salary configuration after leave request may not automatically update pending deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Handling
claims_to_validate.statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize 366 days in leap years like 2024

claims_to_validate.title: Decimal Precision in Daily Wage Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently produce amounts less than expected by small decimal points (0.1 or 0.2).

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Constraint
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, not prorated for mid-month departures

claims_to_validate.title: Service Duration Day Counting Rules
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are handled

claims_to_validate.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Rigid Leave Salary Calculation Logic
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculation follows a fixed policy setting that cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios or month lengths.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Encashment Calculation Based on Monthly Working Days
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave encashment daily wage is calculated using the number of working days in each month, which causes monthly variations

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors.

claims_to_validate.title: Working Days Calculation Based on Work Week
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage proration is calculated based on the employee's assigned work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Limited Proration Date Handling
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration only works correctly for departure dates in the past, not for future departure dates.

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Deduction Management
claims_to_validate.statement: The system cannot reliably manage payroll deductions when leave transactions are modified, deleted, or have status changes.

claims_to_validate.title: Cannot Recalculate Salary Deductions Retroactively
claims_to_validate.statement: The system cannot automatically recalculate salary deductions when public holidays are added after initial payroll calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for calculating daily wage, which differs from calendar days

claims_to_validate.title: Leap Year Day Calculation for Unpaid Leave
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations must use the actual number of calendar days in a month, particularly for February in leap years (29 days, not 31 days).

claims_to_validate.title: Global Settings Override Policy Configurations
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
